inclusion.criterion: received IC by a consistent person
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: healthy child with spina bifida who requires clean intermittent catheterization (CIC)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: child either self-catheterizes or receives catheterization by a consistent person
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: child/parent/caregiver able to read and understand English in order to consent to participation in the study and to respond to verbal questions about the experience and satisfaction with the catheter
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: prophylaxis; allergy to PVC product; diabetes mellitus; history of bladder pathology (i.e. tumours, calculus); surgical history of augmentation (cystoplasty, continent diversion)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a neurogenic bladder with an indwelling suprapubic catheter and a history of recurrent UTIs. They also have multiple comorbidities, including hypertension, BPH, and SLE. However, they do not have any contraindications to participating in the study.
